1: The city he founded is on the holy mountains.
2: The Lord loves the gates of Zion more than all the other dwellings of Jacob.
3: Glorious things are spoken about you, O City of God. Interlude
4: I will register Rahab[a] and Babylon among those who know me. Look! Philistia and Tyre are there, along with Cush! Of them I say, “This one was born there in Zion.”[b]
5: And about Zion it will be said, “This one and that one were born in her, and the Most High himself will establish her.”
6: When he registers the peoples, the Lord will write: “This one was born there.” Interlude
7: Then the singers, as they dance, will sing, “All my springs are in you.”
